intro: Randia obscura, commonly known as the dark randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough texture. Randia obscura is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
